intro: Naudinia forsteri, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used traditionally by Māori for its fibrous leaves. Naudinia forsteri thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in forested areas. Its unique botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and cultural contexts.
